main event: An unidentified object was sighted by Airman James G. Bartling at 0230 hours on 7 October 1957 while on routine flight line duties.
interesting points: The object was described as being approximately 100 feet in diameter and round or disc-shaped., It was observed for about 15 minutes at an altitude of about 2000 feet., The object accelerated rapidly and disappeared from view., An Air Force F-89 jet interceptor was scrambled to investigate but could not locate the object., The case is classified as UNIDENTIFIED due to its unusual characteristics.
location: Elmendorf Air Force Base, Alaska, USA
witness description: Airman James G. Bartling and Captain George A. Roberts
